lines.text: So. We know there’s a Stop Wizard in that statue-
Which is why we’ve been whispering all of this, even though the font size is normal.
Huh? Yeah. I know, my ears are- font size?
We talked about this. The tiny font for whispering would be annoying to read constantly, so I cast a spell to-
Kid, leave the fourth wall alone. You know that’s not funny anymore, right?
That kinda meta nonsense has been played out for almost a decade, now.
Has it? What do you think, player?
Seriously. Cut it out. We’re on the verge of solving this case.
No thanks to a certain forensic scientist.
...I maintain that you can’t prove anything.
And- and you haven’t solved anything yet! It’s… all just- it’s all just guesswork!
Except for how the statue has suspicious breathing holes in its beard, of course.
Right. The Stop Wizard faked his death, and the Go Wizard started a fire to hide how Slick died.
Question is… if Slick’s got that bullet hole in him, and there was only the one gunshot…
How come we’ve got <c=#FF00FF>two</c> corpses with gunshot wounds?
Well… do we? Maybe one’s faking his death, just like the Stop Wizard!
...Hm. Possible.
I think we oughta get some things straight, first.
Let’s start by figuring out exactly what happened with that gunshot. If we can figure that out, the rest should be easy.
Sounds good. So, the question we’re asking first is…
Someone had to pull the trigger on that gun. Do we have <c=#FF00FF>any way to know</c> who it was?
